comments.body: I'm not entirely sure if it matters, but this behavior is different from Babel's transformer. In theory we want a dot character here instead of a \u sequence.
This is because the synthetic literal now passes through `escapeNonAsciiCharacters` which encodes the dot.

I will accept this baseline for now, but may revisit as we discuss whether we need to call `escapeNonAsciiCharacters` for every synthetic literal. It may only really be useful for performing string canonicalization for module import deduplication.
